Package com.github.sahasatvik.cli

This package contains ArgHandler, and all of the classes required by it. ArgHandler is a simple argument parsing library, which simplifies the management of command line arguments.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.3, 04/04/2016
Author:
Satvik Saha
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Parser<T>
    This interface provides methods for parsing objects into one another.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArgHandler
    This class parses command line arguments, and enables simple retrieval of options and arguments.
    Argument
    This class describes a command line argument.
    Option<T>
    This is the class describing a command line Option.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ArgHandlerException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to ArgHandler.
    ArgumentException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to the parsing of arguments in ArgHandler.
    CannotParseValueOfOptionException
    A CannotParseValueOfOptionException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of options in ArgHandler.
    IncorrectOptionSyntaxException
    This is the class describes Exceptions related to errors in creation of a Option object.
    InvalidOptionException
    An InvalidOptionException describes the nature of an error on parsing options in ArgHandler.
    MissingOptionValueException
    An MissingOptionValueException describes the nature of an error on parsing options in ArgHandler.
    NoArgumentOfRequiredTypeFoundException
    A NoArgumentOfRequiredTypeFoundException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of arguments in ArgHandler.
    NoRemainingArgumentsException
    This is the class describing when no arguments remain in the argument queue in ArgHandler.
    OptionException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to the parsing of options in ArgHandler.
    UnknownOptionValueTypeException
    A UnknownOptionValueTypeException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of options in ArgHandler.
